newsitem.title: USA: XOX to pare workforce, focus on geoscience.
newsitem.headline: XOX to pare workforce, focus on geoscience.

text.p: XOX Corp said Friday it is instituting a restructuring that will include a reduction in its worforce and expansion of its presence in the geoscience industry by extending its product offerings into application specific advanced applications tools.

The company said it is cutting its workforce by five, including a restructuring of its financial organization and elimination of the active position of chief financial officer. Lawrence McGraw, president and chief executive, will act as CFO of the software company.

"The reduction in workforce will ensure short-term financial efficiency and accelerate the ability of XOX to be profitable," McGraw said in a statement. "We expect this action will have a minimal impact on 1997 revenues," he said.
In 1996, XOX reported a loss of $1.7 million or $0.81 per share on revenues of $806,506.

McGraw said the company's prospects in the geoscience industry were bolstered by its recent agreement with a major oil company and the planned release of products based on the company's SHAPES Geometric Computing System.
